snippet: Democratic leaders are now fretfully talking about a prospect they once considered unthinkable: Charles Barron being elected to Congress.
abstract: New York City Councilman Charles Barron is gaining in the polls in the race for a newly configured Brooklyn Congressional district, running against Assemblyman Hakeem S Jeffries; Barron has long been viewed by members of the Democratic establishment as a political provocateur, and his sudden surge is alarming some who fear he would be an alienating figure on the national stage.

byline.original: By JOSEPH BERGER and MICHAEL M. GRYNBAUM

lead_paragraph: Democratic leaders are now fretfully talking about a prospect they once considered unthinkable: Charles Barron being elected to Congress.

headline.seo: In Brooklyn, Councilman Charles Barron Surges in a Primary Race for Congress
headline.main: In Brooklyn, a Longtime Provocateur Surges in a Primary Race for Congress
headline.print_headline: In Brooklyn, a Longtime Provocateur Surges in a Primary Race for Congress
